page.title: 14Drayton Soldier & Stonemason
page.content: I was born at Ashdale Road,Powrhiwfor,Pondypridd in 1917.I moved to Somerset in 1921 and lived at Westport.I attended Hambridge school from the age of 5.At 14,I started work for Mr Vile of Puckington who was a local builder.While I trained to be a stone_mason my wages were 5 shillings a week.I married on 4th February 1939 and moved to Drayton in 1940.We have now lived in Court Cottage for 45 years.The house is about 200 years old with a stone spiral staircase,an inglenook fireplace and lots of beams.When the 1939_1945 war started, I joined the Royal Engineers.I was evacuated from Dunkirk and then served in North Africa and Italy.I left the army in May 1946 and started work as a stone_mason at Muchelney Abbey and at a private school in Curry Rivel.I retired in 1981.
